DOC.brief_title: Interactive Gentle Yoga Improving Quality Life Patients With Stage I-III Breast Cancer Undergoing Radiation Therapy
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine feasibility implement 6-week biweekly yoga intervention deliver multi-point videoconferencing breast cancer patient undergo radiation therapy . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To obtain preliminary data change depression , anxiety , fatigue , sleep quality pre- post-intervention woman breast cancer undergo radiation therapy . II . To obtain preliminary data acute effect yoga class fatigue distress . OUTLINE : Participants undergo 12 session cancer-adapted integral yoga class use internet-based videoconferencing platform . Integral yoga include posture , deep relaxation , breathe practice meditation create profound experience peace well-being . Participants take part study class home ( location convenient participant allow access internet-based class ) two-way interaction group instructor member alike 75 minute twice weekly 6 week radiation therapy . Participants encourage complete additional yoga practice session outside twice weekly study session . After completion study , participant follow 1 week .
